cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles WSW of Key West, Florida (and 125 miles WNW of Havana, Cuba)
cyclone.trajectory: Now moving west but forecast to turn northwest on Tuesday and then north, tracking toward the northeast Gulf Coast of Florida, then crossing Georgia and moving back offshore near the GA/SC coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / northeast Gulf Coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend to Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) possible late Thursday night into Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible in the Savannah River estuary and adjacent coastline if the center tracks just inland
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain possible with locally higher totals causing ponding and localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions, possible minor coastal flooding at high tide, and navigation restrictions in the Savannah River channel
